questions.question: An object moves $45$ meters in $3$ seconds. What is its average speed?
A $12\text{ kg}$ box is pushed with a net force of $36\text{ N}$. What is its acceleration?
questions.explanation: Newton's Second Law: $a = \frac{F}{m} = \frac{36\text{ N}}{12\text{ kg}} = 3\text{ m/s}^2$.

questions.question: If an object's mass is $8\text{ kg}$ on Earth, what is its mass on the Moon where gravity is $1/6$ of Earth's?
questions.explanation: Mass is an intrinsic property and does not change with location. Only weight changes with gravity.

questions.question: A $4\,\Omega$ and an $8\,\Omega$ resistor are connected in series. What is the total resistance?
How much work is done when a $20\text{ N}$ force moves an object $5$ meters in the direction of the force?
questions.explanation: Work $= F \times d = 20\text{ N} \times 5\text{ m} = 100\text{ J}$.

questions.question: A $2\text{ kg}$ ball travels at $10\text{ m/s}$. What is its momentum?
If a $100\text{ W}$ lightbulb stays on for $10$ seconds, how much energy is used?
questions.explanation: Energy $= P \times t = 100\text{ W} \times 10\text{ s} = 1{,}000\text{ J}$.

questions.question: A car slows down from $30\text{ m/s}$ to $10\text{ m/s}$ in $5$ seconds. What is its acceleration?
What is the weight of a $15\text{ kg}$ object on Earth? (use $g = 9.8\text{ m/s}^2$)
A $500\text{ kg}$ car has $10{,}000\text{ J}$ of kinetic energy. What is its speed?
A circuit has a $12\text{ V}$ battery and a $3\text{ A}$ current. What is the resistance?
An object with a mass of $400\text{ g}$ has a volume of $50\text{ cm}^3$. What is its density?
If you double the distance between two point charges, by what factor does the electric force change?
questions.explanation: Coulomb's Law: $F \propto \frac{1}{r^2}$. Doubling distance reduces force by factor of $\frac{1}{(2)^2} = \frac{1}{4}$.

questions.question: A $3\text{ kg}$ stone is held $4$ meters above the ground. What is its gravitational potential energy? (use $g = 10\text{ m/s}^2$)
Two $10\,\Omega$ resistors are connected in parallel. What is their combined resistance?
A machine does $600\text{ J}$ of useful work but requires $800\text{ J}$ of input energy. What is its efficiency?
If a wire carries $5\text{ C}$ of charge in $2$ seconds, what is the current?
A ball is dropped from rest from a building. What is its velocity after $4$ seconds? (use $g = 9.8\text{ m/s}^2$)
What happens to the current in a circuit if the voltage is tripled and resistance stays the same?
questions.explanation: Ohm's Law: $I = \frac{V}{R}$. If $V$ triples and $R$ is constant, $I$ triples.

questions.question: A crane lifts a $1{,}000\text{ N}$ load $20$ meters in $10$ seconds. What is its power output?
questions.explanation: Work $= Fd = 1{,}000\text{ N} \times 20\text{ m} = 20{,}000\text{ J}$. Power $= \frac{\text{Work}}{\text{time}} = \frac{20{,}000\text{ J}}{10\text{ s}} = 2{,}000\text{ W}$.

questions.question: If an object has a momentum of $50\text{ kg}\cdot\text{m/s}$ and a mass of $5\text{ kg}$, what is its velocity?
A $200\text{ V}$ heater draws $10\text{ A}$ of current. How much power does it use?
An object is moving at constant velocity. What is the net force acting on it?
questions.explanation: Constant velocity means zero acceleration. By Newton's Second Law, zero acceleration implies zero net force.

questions.question: If a person pushes against a wall with $50\text{ N}$ of force, how much force does the wall exert on the person?
questions.explanation: Newton's Third Law: For every action force, there is an equal and opposite reaction force.

questions.question: A $0.5\text{ kg}$ bird is flying at $20\text{ m/s}$. What is its kinetic energy?
If the voltage across a resistor is $24\text{ V}$ and the current is $2\text{ A}$, what is the power dissipated?
Convert $0.005$ kilometers into centimeters.
questions.explanation: $0.005\text{ km} = 5\text{ m} = 500\text{ cm}$ (since $1\text{ km} = 1000\text{ m}$ and $1\text{ m} = 100\text{ cm}$).

questions.question: A swimmer travels $100$ meters in $50$ seconds. What is their average speed?
An object weighs $98\text{ N}$ on Earth. What is its mass? (use $g = 9.8\text{ m/s}^2$)
questions.explanation: Weight $= mg \rightarrow m = \frac{W}{g} = \frac{98\text{ N}}{9.8\text{ m/s}^2} = 10\text{ kg}$.

questions.question: A spring is compressed $0.2$ meters using a $10\text{ N}$ force. What is the spring constant?
questions.explanation: Hooke's Law: $F = kx \rightarrow k = \frac{F}{x} = \frac{10\text{ N}}{0.2\text{ m}} = 50\text{ N/m}$.

questions.question: If a circuit breaker trips when current exceeds $15\text{ A}$, will a $3{,}600\text{ W}$ appliance on a $240\text{ V}$ line trip it?
questions.explanation: $I = \frac{P}{V} = \frac{3{,}600\text{ W}}{240\text{ V}} = 15\text{ A}$. This is at the limit, so it may not trip immediately but is at the threshold.

questions.question: A $60\text{ kg}$ skater pushes off a wall with $120\text{ N}$ of force. What is their initial acceleration?
questions.explanation: Newton's Second Law: $a = \frac{F}{m} = \frac{120\text{ N}}{60\text{ kg}} = 2\text{ m/s}^2$.

questions.question: If a car travels $150\text{ km}$ at a constant speed of $75\text{ km/h}$, how long does the trip take?
A $2\text{ kg}$ object is falling. If air resistance is $5\text{ N}$ upward, what is the net force? (use $g = 10\text{ m/s}^2$)
questions.explanation: Weight $= mg = 2 \times 10 = 20\text{ N}$ downward. Net force $= 20\text{ N}\downarrow - 5\text{ N}\uparrow = 15\text{ N}$ downward.

questions.question: What is the resistance of a bulb that draws $0.5\text{ A}$ when connected to $120\text{ V}$?
A $10\text{ kg}$ rock is at the top of a $50$ meter cliff. What is its gravitational potential energy? (use $g = 9.8\text{ m/s}^2$)
If the charge on each of two objects is doubled, but the distance stays the same, how does the electric force change?
questions.explanation: Coulomb's Law: $F \propto q_1 q_2$. Doubling both charges multiplies the product by $2 \times 2 = 4$.

questions.question: A runner accelerates uniformly from rest to $6\text{ m/s}$ in $2$ seconds. What distance is covered during this time?
questions.explanation: For uniform acceleration from rest: $s = \frac{1}{2}(v_i + v_f)t = \frac{1}{2}(0 + 6)(2) = 6\text{ m}$.

questions.question: How much energy does a $1{,}500\text{ W}$ toaster use in $1$ minute?
questions.explanation: Energy $= P \times t = 1{,}500\text{ W} \times 60\text{ s} = 90{,}000\text{ J}$.

questions.question: Three $9\,\Omega$ resistors are connected in parallel. What is the equivalent resistance?
An object has a density of $1{,}200\text{ kg/m}^3$ and a volume of $2\text{ m}^3$. What is its mass?
A $40\text{ N}$ force is applied at an angle where the horizontal component is $30\text{ N}$. If the object moves $10$ meters horizontally, how much work is done?
questions.explanation: Work is done only by the component of force in the direction of motion: $W = F_{\text{horizontal}} \times d = 30\text{ N} \times 10\text{ m} = 300\text{ J}$.

questions.question: If a motor is $80\%$ efficient, how much energy is wasted when $500\text{ J}$ of energy is supplied?
questions.explanation: Useful output $= 80\%$ of $500\text{ J} = 400\text{ J}$. Wasted energy $= \text{Input} - \text{Useful} = 500\text{ J} - 400\text{ J} = 100\text{ J}$.

questions.question: A $5\text{ kg}$ ball moving at $4\text{ m/s}$ hits a wall and stops in $0.2$ seconds. What is the average force of the impact?
questions.explanation: Impulse $= \Delta p = F\Delta t$. $\Delta p = m\Delta v = 5(0-4) = -20\text{ kg}\cdot\text{m/s}$. $F = \frac{\Delta p}{\Delta t} = \frac{20}{0.2} = 100\text{ N}$.

questions.question: What is the current in a $60\text{ W}$ bulb connected to a $12\text{ V}$ source?
An elevator lifts a $500\text{ kg}$ mass $10$ meters in $5$ seconds. What is the power output? (use $g = 10\text{ m/s}^2$)
questions.explanation: Work $= mgh = 500 \times 10 \times 10 = 50{,}000\text{ J}$. Power $= \frac{\text{Work}}{\text{time}} = \frac{50{,}000\text{ J}}{5\text{ s}} = 10{,}000\text{ W}$.

questions.question: If the resistance in a circuit is halved while voltage is constant, what happens to the current?
questions.explanation: Ohm's Law: $I = \frac{V}{R}$. If $R$ is halved and $V$ is constant, $I$ doubles.

questions.question: A projectile is launched vertically at $20\text{ m/s}$. At its peak, vertical velocity is $0\text{ m/s}$. How long did it take to reach the peak? (use $g = 10\text{ m/s}^2$)
A $100\text{ kg}$ cart moving at $2\text{ m/s}$ has a $50\text{ kg}$ mass dropped vertically into it. What is the new velocity? (Conservation of momentum)
How many millimeters are in $2.5$ meters?
